meanings.definition: A person who dissents or disagrees with a prevailing belief or practice.
meanings.sent1: The deccenters voiced their opposition to the new policy at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The deccenters in the group challenged the traditional way of thinking.
meanings.sent3: The deccenters decided to wear mismatched socks to show their rebellion.
meanings.sent4: She stood out like a deccenters in a sea of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The deccenters were like colorful puzzle pieces in a black-and-white world.

meanings.definition: The act of dissenting or disagreeing with a prevailing belief or practice.
meanings.sent1: The deccenters of the community gathered to discuss their concerns.
meanings.sent2: The deccenters of the debate brought up valid points against the proposal.
meanings.sent3: Their constant deccenters made the meetings more lively and interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her bold deccenters were like sparks igniting a fire of change.
meanings.sent5: The deccenters of the group were like a refreshing breeze in a stuffy room.
